intro: Hieracium porrigentiforme, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are broadly lanceolate. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium porrigentiforme is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, and it can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
